intro: Cyphostemma sokodense, commonly known as the Sokodense moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicles containing elongated, hard seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its unique appearance and growth habit, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
